titleStmt.title: John McKillop to James W. Tate
CWG7960

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

creation.placeName: New York City, New York County, New York

body.p:
The Commercial Agency,
37 PARK ROW & 146 NASSAU ST.
New York April 21st 1863
James W. Tate Esq.
Frankfort, Ky.
Dear Sir:

Mr Jos G. Wilson was connected with this office and held the appointment of Commissioner of Deeds for a majority of the States, for the convenience of the many commercial men who come daily to the office. As he left for Europe some time ago, I would respectfully solicit the transfer of the appointment to George O. Manchester, of this City. I enclose the fee of $500.

Very Respectfully,
John McKillop of McKillop & Co.

New York
Commr of Deeds
Geo O. Manchester
"City"
Appd May 8th 1863
